Dedicated and accomplished Finance Professional with extensive experience in FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT & BUDGETING seeks a management position where I can further enhance the achievement of an organization's objectives and targets.
Experience in diverse industries includes financial services, retail, distribution, FORTUNE 500 and BIG 4 companies.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Finance Manager - Global Product Organization

Location: Boston, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Finance Manager – Global Product Organization (GPO)

About This Position

We have an exciting opportunity for a Finance Manager located in Boston, MA. This position will function as a key business partner to the GPO organization, which falls under Aptiv’s Advanced Safety and User Experience segment. The role leads financial analysis and reporting activity, as well as analysis of commercial and strategic initiatives. Candidate must be self-motivated, able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and be able to engage with the various business teams.

This role is highly visible and provides an excellent opportunity for a motivated professional to accelerate career growth opportunities.

Responsibilities And Duties

Provide financial oversight and guidance to the Global Product Organization. Collaborate with Product Management and other GPO teams to work on the business pursuits. Close alignment with the AS&UX Finance team on the work required for program and customer profitability. Partner with business unit leadership to define, track and analyze key business and financial metrics Lead monthly management reporting of financial results and forecasts. Develop, consolidate, compare and analyze actual results against plans and forecasts; monitor variances; identify trends and recommend changes to the leadership team Coordinate the analysis and development of the annual budget. Management and development of two financial analysts. 

Basic Qualifications

BS in Finance or Accounting 5+ years of experience in corporate finance/financial planning & analysis or related field Accountability with ability to independently lead and manage complex projects across multiple topics Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment Prior experience with Financial Reporting & Analysis in a relevant industry Good understanding of Financial and Accounting principles Highly proficient with Word, Excel and PowerPoint 

Preferred Qualifications:

MBA, or CPA a plus Good business process/product understanding Attention to various deadlines Must be proactive, resourceful and demonstrate intellectual curiosity to predict business needs Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal 

Traits we seek

Curiously investigate everything – ability to solving problems analytically, creatively and collaboratively Lead with confidence – thought leaders who empower those around them Learn by doing – an entrepreneurial mindset that’s driven by hands-on experimentation Embrace resilience – seeing every challenge as a learning opportunity and invitation to grow 

Why join us?

You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.

Your Benefits at Aptiv:

Private health care effective day 1 of employmentLife and accident insuranceHybrid and flexible working hoursPaid Time Off (Holidays, Vacation, Designated time off, Parental leave)Relocation assistance may be availableLearning and development opportunitiesDiscount programs with various manufacturers and retailersRecognition for innovation and excellenceOpportunities to give back to the communityTuition ReimbursementAdoption AssistanceFertility Coverage

Apply today, and together let’s change tomorrow! 

Candidates for positions with Aptiv must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. 

Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
